raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual demonstrates a strong preference for quality storytelling, particularly within the suspense and drama genres, as indicated by consistently high ratings for shows that engage their interest. They favor complex narratives that evolve over time, although they express disappointment when series lose depth or coherence, as seen with their low rating for a show characterized as “silly” after a strong start. 

There is an inclination toward nuanced social themes, particularly when historical contexts are presented authentically in media. The reviews also reflect a growing fatigue with typical genre tropes, signaling a desire for originality in narrative arcs, especially in horror and dystopian settings.

Quality seems more significant than price, as the individual remains committed to obtaining compelling content, regardless of associated costs. Their emotional investment is significant, with reviews expressing hope for series continuity or a desire for deeper treatment of subjects.

Overall, this person values engaging, well-crafted stories with strong character development, while also seeking authenticity in portrayal. Price sensitivity appears minimal compared to their desire for quality viewing experiences, indicating a preference for artistic value over budget constraints.

target_interaction.title: Four Stars
target_interaction.text: Way better then Bateman v superman. The story was a hell of lot better.
